result.execSummary:
The defendant Dale N. Christiansen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dale N. Christiansen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dale N. Christiansen was found guilty of Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Dale N. Christiansen was found guilty of Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st) (PAC<0.15), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dale N. Christiansen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dale N. Christiansen in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:39 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  State files amended information amending Count 1. 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Counts 1 & 3 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1 as amended and Count 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Counts 2 & 4 are dismissed. 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - 
Pay fine of $300 plus costs including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan. 
Provide a DNA sample. 

Count 3 - 
Serve 30 days jail. 
1 day credit.
Huber for purposes of work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
If he qualifies for home detention, may serve the last half of the sentence on home detention after an evaluation by the sheriff's department.
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date and time. 
Pay fine of $300 plus costs including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan. 
12 months revocation.  Commencing upon occupational license or reinstatement of the license. 
12 months IID.  Effective today. 
DOT Assessment and comply with the safety plan. 

Atty Knaapen makes arguments re: IID effective date.

Defendant Dale N. Christiansen in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dale N. Christiansen in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:10 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Atty Kryshak has received a copy of the complaint, waives reading and enters pleas of NOT GUILTY.
Atty Kryshak requests a preliminary hearing, waives time limits. 

Atty Cousins concurs.

Court will not accept a NOT GUILTY plea  at this time.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
